message: Hi Bob, I have a great product that I think you'll really like. I'm looking to sell it to you for $150.
I'm interested in the product, but $150 is a bit high for me. I'm willing to pay $100 for it.
I understand you're looking for a better deal, but I'm not willing to go as low as $100. I can offer you a compromise at $135. It's the lowest I can go, but I think it's a fair price for the product.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $135 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to pay $115 for the product.
I'm still not willing to go as low as $115. I can offer you a slightly higher compromise at $130. I think this is the best price I can offer, and it's still a good deal for you.
I'm still not convinced that $130 is the best price for me. I'm willing to pay $125 for the product.

I'm getting close to my minimum price, but I'm still willing to make a bit of a concession. I can offer you the product for $128. This is as low as I'm willing to go, and I think it's still a fair price for the product.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $128 is still a bit high for me. I'm willing to pay $122 for the product.

I've reached my minimum price, and I'm not willing to go any lower. I can offer you the product for $125, but I think it's the absolute lowest price I can accept. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options.
I understand you've reached your minimum price, but I'm still not willing to pay $125. I'm willing to pay $123 for the product.
